_header: Yore it was I-settled through wise and erendrake [Ȝare hit was isuteled þurh wise and erndrake]
_description: A ‘text’ in a Worcestershire sermon on the Incarnation — two couplets

WorcQ29.Transcription:
ȝare hit was isuteled þurh wise and erndrakeÞet god
                    wold mon bicumen al for ure sakeny[?] it is soþed to dei he is
                    iborenIf iboren [ ] þis worlde were forlore
WorcQ29.Note:
2 x 2 in a Latin sermon on incarnation, written as prose and followed by
                    more English prose.
WorcQ29.Editions:
Stanley,  Eric Gerald. 
             “An Inedited Nativity Sermon from Worcester.” 
             English and Germanic Studies
         7 (1961): 53-79: 61.
